info.title: NVIDIA NIM for LLMs
info.summary: Accelerated LLM inference for NVIDIA GPUs.

schema.title: Response Create Chat Completion V1 Chat Completions Post

400.description: Received an invalid request possibly containing unsupported or out-of-range parameter values.

404.description: The requested model does not exist.

400.description: Received an invalid request possibly containing unsupported or out-of-range parameter values.

schema.title: Response Create Llama Stack Completion Experimental Ls Inference Completion Post

400.description: Received an invalid request possibly containing unsupported or out-of-range parameter values.

404.description: The requested model does not exist.

get.description: This endpoint will return a list of models available for inference. When the NIM is set up to serve customizations (e.g. LoRAs) this will also return the customizations available as models.

get.summary: Returns version information about this NIM
get.description: The `release` attribute corresponds to the product release version of the NIM. The `api` attribute is the openapi server API version running inside the NIM.

stop_reason.title: Stop Reason
stop_reason.description: The stop string or token id that caused the completion to stop, None if the completion finished for some other reason including encountering the EOS token

stop_reason.title: Stop Reason
stop_reason.description: The stop string or token id that caused the completion to stop, None if the completion finished for some other reason including encountering the EOS token

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the license for the NIM container.

path.title: Path
path.description: The filepath within the container containing the license content.

sha.title: Sha
sha.description: A SHA1 hash of the license contents.

size.title: Size
size.description: The number of characters in the license content.

url.title: Url
url.description: The url where this license is hosted externally.

type.title: Type
type.description: The format of the license content.

LicenseEndpointModel.title: LicenseEndpointModel
LicenseEndpointModel.description: A model representing the license response.

manifest_file.title: Manifest File
manifest_file.description: The content of the manifest file describing the required model artifacts.

repository_override.title: Repository Override
repository_override.description: Alternate location used to retrieve artifacts from manifest file.

ManifestEndpointModel.title: ManifestEndpointModel
ManifestEndpointModel.description: A model representing the manifest response.

assetInfo.title: Assetinfo
assetInfo.description: A list of required container assets excluding model artifacts

modelInfo.title: Modelinfo
modelInfo.description: A list of models being served by the NIM.

repository_override.title: Repository Override
repository_override.description: Alternate location used to retrieve artifacts from manifest file.

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the NIM service.

selectedModelProfileId.title: Selectedmodelprofileid
selectedModelProfileId.description: The ID of the currently selected model profile.

MetadataEndpointModel.title: MetadataEndpointModel
MetadataEndpointModel.description: A model representing the metadata response.

ModelInfo.title: ModelInfo
ModelInfo.description: A model representing the model response.

assetName.title: Assetname
assetName.description: The name of the asset used by NIMs.

url.title: Url
url.description: The url of the asset being used.

role.description: The role of the message's author.

content.title: Content
content.description: The contents of the message. For a reward model, the predicted attributes, i.e. reward scores, will be returned.

tool_call_id.title: Tool Call Id
tool_call_id.description: The id of the tool call.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the tool called.

tool_calls.title: Tool Calls
tool_calls.description: The tool(s) called by the model.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the `content` of `message`.

top_logprobs.title: Top Logprobs
top_logprobs.description: An integer specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to `true` if this parameter is used.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens that can be generated.

max_completion_tokens.title: Max Completion Tokens
max_completion_tokens.description: Alternative to max_tokens. If set, will be used as max_tokens.

n.title: N
n.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables JSON mode, which guarantees the message the model generates is valid JSON.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Changing the seed will produce a different response with similar characteristics. Fixing the seed will reproduce the same results if all other parameters are also kept constant.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: Sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent, like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only [server-sent events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events#Event_stream_format) as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]`

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or `temperature` but not both.

tool_choice.title: Tool Choice
tool_choice.description: Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user.

top_k.title: Top K
top_k.description: How many of the top tokens to sample from. Must be -1 or greater than or equal to 1.

repetition_penalty.title: Repetition Penalty
repetition_penalty.description: How much to penalize tokens based on how frequently they occur in the text. A value of 1 means no penalty, while values larger than 1 discourage and values smaller encourage.

include_stop_str_in_output.title: Include Stop Str In Output
include_stop_str_in_output.description: Whether to include the stop string in the output. This is only applied when the stop or stop_token_ids is set. Can be a boolean or null.

ignore_eos.title: Ignore Eos
ignore_eos.description: Whether to ignore End of Sequence (EOS) tokens. It is advised to set max_tokens when this is set to avoid overly long response times.

min_tokens.title: Min Tokens
min_tokens.description: Min Tokens, can be an integer or null.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true, special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt on top of what is added by the chat template. For most models, the chat template takes care of adding the special tokens so this should be set to false (as is the default).

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: A list of dicts representing documents that will be accessible to the model if it is performing RAG (retrieval-augmented generation). If the template does not support RAG, this argument will have no effect. We recommend that each document should be a dict containing "title" and "text" keys.

chat_template.title: Chat Template
chat_template.description: A Jinja template to use for this conversion. As of transformers v4.44, default chat template is no longer allowed, so you must provide a chat template if the tokenizer does not define one.

chat_template_kwargs.title: Chat Template Kwargs
chat_template_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the template renderer. Will be accessible by the chat template.

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

guided_json.title: Guided Json
guided_json.description: If specified, the output will follow the JSON schema. Can be a string, an object, a reference to a BaseModel, or null.

guided_regex.title: Guided Regex
guided_regex.description: If specified, the output will follow the regex pattern. Can be a string or null.

guided_choice.title: Guided Choice
guided_choice.description: If specified, the output will be exactly one of the choices.

guided_grammar.title: Guided Grammar
guided_grammar.description: If specified, the output will follow the context-free grammar. Can be a string or null.

guided_decoding_backend.title: Guided Decoding Backend
guided_decoding_backend.description: If specified, will override the default guided decoding backend of the server for this specific request. If set, must be one of 'outlines' / 'lm-format-enforcer' / name of a custom decoding backend

guided_whitespace_pattern.title: Guided Whitespace Pattern
guided_whitespace_pattern.description: If specified, will override the default whitespace pattern for guided json decoding.

request_id.title: Request Id
request_id.description: The request_id related to this request. If the caller does not set it, a random_uuid will be generated. This id is used through out the inference process and return in response.

return_tokens_as_token_ids.title: Return Tokens As Token Ids
return_tokens_as_token_ids.description: If specified with 'logprobs', tokens are represented  as strings of the form 'token_id:{token_id}' so that tokens that are not JSON-encodable can be identified.

user_metadata.title: User Metadata
user_metadata.description: User metadata to be passed forward

best_of.title: Best Of
best_of.description: Supported for completion only. Generates best_of completions server-side and returns top n 'best' (with the highest cumulative log probability). Results cannot be streamed. When used with n, best_of controls the number of candidate completions and n specifies how many to return - best_of must be greater than n. When best_of != n, best_of is returned by the backend API and n-slicing is done at request output.

echo.title: Echo
echo.description: If true, echo back the prompt in addition to the completion. 'echo' and 'stream' fields cannot be true simultaneously.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Include the log probabilities on the `logprobs` most likely output tokens, as well the chosen tokens. For example, if `logprobs` is 5, the API will return a list of the 5 most likely tokens. The API will always return the `logprob` of the sampled token, so there may be up to `logprobs+1` elements in the response.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens that can be generated.

n.title: N
n.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Changing the seed will produce a different response with similar characteristics. Fixing the seed will reproduce the same results if all other parameters are also kept constant.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: Sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent, like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only [server-sent events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events#Event_stream_format) as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]`

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: The suffix that comes after a completion of inserted text.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or `temperature` but not both.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user.

top_k.title: Top K
top_k.description: How many of the top tokens to sample from. Must be -1 or greater than or equal to 1.

repetition_penalty.title: Repetition Penalty
repetition_penalty.description: How much to penalize tokens based on how frequently they occur in the text. A value of 1 means no penalty, while values larger than 1 discourage and values smaller encourage.

include_stop_str_in_output.title: Include Stop Str In Output
include_stop_str_in_output.description: Whether to include the stop string in the output. This is only applied when the stop or stop_token_ids is set. Can be a boolean or null.

ignore_eos.title: Ignore Eos
ignore_eos.description: Whether to ignore End of Sequence (EOS) tokens. It is advised to set max_tokens when this is set to avoid overly long response times.

min_tokens.title: Min Tokens
min_tokens.description: Min Tokens, can be an integer or null.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true (the default), special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt.

response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables JSON mode, which guarantees the message the model generates is valid JSON.

guided_json.title: Guided Json
guided_json.description: If specified, the output will follow the JSON schema. Can be a string, an object, a reference to a BaseModel, or null.

guided_regex.title: Guided Regex
guided_regex.description: If specified, the output will follow the regex pattern. Can be a string or null.

guided_choice.title: Guided Choice
guided_choice.description: If specified, the output will be exactly one of the choices.

guided_grammar.title: Guided Grammar
guided_grammar.description: If specified, the output will follow the context-free grammar. Can be a string or null.

guided_decoding_backend.title: Guided Decoding Backend
guided_decoding_backend.description: If specified, will override the default guided decoding backend of the server for this specific request. If set, must be one of 'outlines' / 'lm-format-enforcer' / name of a custom decoding backend

guided_whitespace_pattern.title: Guided Whitespace Pattern
guided_whitespace_pattern.description: If specified, will override the default whitespace pattern for guided json decoding. Must be used with guided_json. Supported in 'outlines' backend.

return_tokens_as_token_ids.title: Return Tokens As Token Ids
return_tokens_as_token_ids.description: If specified with 'logprobs', tokens are represented  as strings of the form 'token_id:{token_id}' so that tokens that are not JSON-encodable can be identified.

user_metadata.title: User Metadata
user_metadata.description: User metadata to be passed forward

release.title: Release
release.description: The product release version of NIM for LLMs.

api.title: Api
api.description: The server API version running inside the NIM.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the NIMs license.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path of the NIMs license file inside the container.

sha.title: Sha
sha.description: The unique identifier of the license.

size.title: Size
size.description: The size of the license file in bytes.

url.title: Url
url.description: The url of the NIMs license.

type.title: Type
type.description: The content type of the license.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content inside the NIMs license file.

version.description: The product release version information of NIM for LLMs

modelInfo.title: Modelinfo
modelInfo.description: The list of information of models being served inside NIMs container

assetInfo.title: Assetinfo
assetInfo.description: The list of different assets used by the NIMs

licenseInfo.description: The information of the license of released NIMs

shortName.title: Shortname
shortName.description: The name of the model served by NIMs

modelUrl.title: Modelurl
modelUrl.description: The URL from which the model is downloaded.

ignore_eos.title: Ignore Eos
ignore_eos.description: Whether to ignore End of Sequence (EOS) tokens. It is advised to set max_tokens when this is set to avoid overly long response times.

repetition_penalty.title: Repetition Penalty
repetition_penalty.description: How much to penalize tokens based on how frequently they occur in the text. A value of 1 means no penalty, while values larger than 1 discourage and values smaller encourage.

top_k.title: Top K
top_k.description: How many of the top tokens to sample from. Must be -1 or greater than or equal to 1, and cannot be null. If not set, then the default is -1 which disables top_k sampling (greedy).

guided_choice.title: Guided Choice
guided_choice.description: If specified, the output will be exactly one of the choices.

guided_json.title: Guided Json
guided_json.description: If specified, the output will follow the JSON schema. Can be a string, an object, a reference to a BaseModel, or null.

guided_regex.title: Guided Regex
guided_regex.description: If specified, the output will follow the regex pattern. Can be a string or null.

guided_grammar.title: Guided Grammar
guided_grammar.description: If specified, the output will follow the context-free grammar. Can be a string or null.

guided_decoding_backend.title: Guided Decoding Backend
guided_decoding_backend.description: If specified, will override the default guided decoding backend of the server for this specific request. If set, must be one of 'xgrammar' / name of a custom decoding backend

min_tokens.title: Min Tokens
min_tokens.description: The minimum number of tokens to generate. If set, the model will generate at least this many tokens before stopping.

max_thinking_tokens.title: Max Thinking Tokens
max_thinking_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to spend on thinking. If set, the model will think for a maximum of this many tokens before generating a response. This is only supported for models that support guided decoding. The model may go slightly over this limit, but will not exceed it by more than 10%.

object.title: Object
object.description: The object of the health response.

message.title: Message
message.description: The message of the health response.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the health response for backwards compatibility.

nimlib__nim_inference_api_builder__commo.title: NIMHealthSuccessResponse
nimlib__nim_inference_api_builder__commo.description: A model representing the health success response.
